climbs.name: Unleash the Kraken
climbs.fa: Deb Evans, Karl Kiser & Noah Monagle, Spring 2016

content.description: The route wanders through several small roofs with the crux above the second bolt.  Movement is good and draws longer than short sport draws is recommended (bolts 3 & 4).
content.protection: 7 bolts to a bolted anchor with chains.
content.location: The route is on the right side of a prominent buttress on the left side of the cliff.  Rap the route.

climbs.name: Preacher's Daughter
climbs.fa: Noah Monagle, Karl Kiser & Bryan Pletta   Fall 2015

content.description: The crux is high where the climbing traverses right to skirt a roof.
content.location: The climb is in the center of the crag (right of a large roof and below the highest point) in a left facing corner system.  Rap the route.

content.description:
Climb up to the first two bolts on large blocks/ ledges. The bottom crux is tightly bolted in the crack over a small roof, moving left after bolt 3. Continue on the left face (in close proximity to "Bolt Action") to bolt #4 , and follow the line back right on the the last 3 bolts through a more sustained section. An alpine draw is recommended for bolt #6 to reduce drag.

 As of now, there are two anchors in place. The lower one on the face does not have chains ( recommended for top ropes ). The anchor after topping out over the large flake to the left, does include chains for cleaning. The grade currently stands at 10b/c after some rock fell off right around the crux. The move is fairly height dependent, the taller you are, the easier this climb should feel.
content.protection: 8 or 9 bolts to the high anchor w/ chains after topping out. Optional two bolt anchor lower on the face w/o chains.
content.location: Located just right of Bolt Action (5.9). There is an obvious overhang at bolt 2 with a thin crack on the face above it.

climbs.name: Little Big Man
climbs.fa: Anna Brown, Mark Grazier & Karl Kiser, Spring 2016

content.description: There are a couple of crux sections (third and fourth bolts) with good rests on ledges.  Fun movement.  Clip the third bolt from a good hold at the top of the arete/corner then climb left.  Be careful around a smaller block (a bit scary) above the fourth bolt, stay on the larger holds to the left before climbing right.
content.protection: 5 bolts to anchor and rap rings.
content.location: The route is a few feet left of a weakness on the the center left buttress (left of the big roof).  Rap the route.

climbs.name: For a Few Bolts More
climbs.fa: Karl Kiser, Mark Grazier & Alex Sfakianos, Spring 2016

content.description: This is another fun warmup route.  Most of the climbing is easier but there are a couple of mini cruxes.  Be careful through the less good rock between the first and second bolts.  The climbing is easy but stay within the cleaned area.
content.protection: 8 bolts to a bolt and chain anchor.
content.location: The route is about 15 feet left of Unleash the Kraken on the same general piece of rock.  Rap the route.

climbs.name: Facecoach
climbs.fa: Anna Brown, Karl Kiser & Teresa Sedlacek, Fall 2018

content.description: Climb up the face holds on positive edges to the bolted anchor.  The crux is around bolts two and three.  This is a good warm up climb for late autumn as the sun comes to this portion of the cliff earlier.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a bolt and chain anchor.
content.location: The route is on the far right of the crag below a small evergreen tree.

content.description: Fun movement through a few small roofs, the crux is about the middle of the route.
content.protection: 7 bolts to a chain and bolt anchor.
content.location: The route is about 100 uphill of Cowboy Yoga.  Rap the route.

climbs.name: Cowboy Yoga
climbs.fa: Bryan Pletta, Noah Monagle & Karl Kiser, Fall 2016

content.description: The crux is the exit from the corner before the good upper holds.  Stick clip the first bolt and cross the choss band to interesting climbing.  The fourth clip should be a long sling. Clip short and extend to prevent rope drag after the fifth bolt is clipped.  There are several long moves on the climb.  Climbing may be a bit harder for shorter persons.
content.protection: 9 bolts to the shared anchor with Preacher's Daughter.
content.location: The start is just a few feet right of Preacher's Daughter and climbs up the prominent dihedral.  The route finishes on the upper face.  Rap the route.

climbs.name: A Fistfull of Bolts
climbs.fa: Mark Grazier, Mark Starr, Karl Kiser, Noah Monagle & Bryan Pletta, Summer 2017

content.description: There are several mini cruxes throughout the climb but good rests take some sting out.  Open alpine draws for bolts 4 and 5 to reduce rope drag.
content.protection: 8 bolts to a chain & bolt anchor.
content.location: The route is located on the left side of the central panel (downhill and left of Preacher's Daughter).  Rap the route.

content.description: Boot Hill is a local, moderate quality, limestone crag above Placitas in Las Huertas Canyon (below Palomas and above Sandia Man Cave).  It is uphill from the road and secluded.  The area has seen little climbing traffic, be aware of some loose material on the routes.  A clip stick is useful.
